actions.description: Activate unconditional forwarding for all voice calls to 'number'
Cancel unconditional forwarding for all voice calls
Check status of unconditional forwarding for voice calls

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: The full phone number to forward calls to (include country code if needed).

notes: Replace 'number' with the full phone number including country code if necessary.

actions.description: Activate unconditional forwarding for all data calls to 'number'
Cancel unconditional forwarding for all data calls
Check status of unconditional forwarding for data calls

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: The full phone number to forward data calls to.

notes: Circuit-switched data calls are largely obsolete. Replace 'number'.

actions.description: Activate unconditional forwarding for all fax calls to 'number'
Cancel unconditional forwarding for all fax calls
Check status of unconditional forwarding for fax calls

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: The full phone number to forward fax calls to.

notes: Circuit-switched fax calls are largely obsolete. Replace 'number'.

actions.description: Activate forwarding when no answer for voice calls to 'number'
Activate forwarding when no answer after 'seconds' (5-30 sec) for voice calls
Cancel forwarding when no answer for voice calls
Check status for no answer forwarding (voice)

input_params.name: seconds
input_params.description: Delay in seconds (5, 10, 15, 20, 25, or 30). Only for timed activation.

notes: Replace 'number'. 'seconds' must be a multiple of 5 (5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30).

actions.description: Activate forwarding when unreachable (off or no signal) for voice calls to 'number'
Cancel forwarding when unreachable for voice calls
Check status for unreachable forwarding (voice)

notes: Replace 'number'. Often forwards to voicemail by default.

actions.description: Activate forwarding when unreachable for fax calls to 'number'
Cancel forwarding when unreachable for fax calls
Check status for unreachable fax calls

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: Number to forward fax calls to.

notes: Circuit-switched fax calls are largely obsolete. Replace 'number'.

actions.description: Activate forwarding when busy for voice calls to 'number'
Cancel forwarding when busy for voice calls
Check status for busy forwarding (voice)

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: Number to forward to when busy.

notes: Replace 'number'.

actions.description: Activate forwarding when busy for data calls to 'number'
Cancel forwarding when busy for data calls
Check status for busy data calls

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: Number to forward data calls to when busy.

notes: Circuit-switched data calls are largely obsolete. Replace 'number'.

actions.description: Cancel ALL call forwarding types (unconditional and conditional for voice, data, fax)

notes: Comprehensive cancel code for all standard forwarding.

actions.description: Cancel all conditional call forwarding (Busy, No Answer, Unreachable)

notes: Leaves unconditional forwarding (**21*) active if set.

actions.description: Activate barring for all outgoing calls
Cancel barring for all outgoing calls
Check status for barring all outgoing calls

input_params.name: password
input_params.description: Network barring password (usually 4 digits). Default is often 0000 or 1234. Contact carrier if unknown.

notes: Requires network barring password (often 0000 or 1234, check with carrier). Affects voice, SMS, data.

actions.description: Activate barring for outgoing voice calls
Cancel barring for outgoing voice calls
Check status for barring outgoing voice calls

notes: Requires network barring password. Service code *11# may vary.

actions.description: Activate barring for outgoing international calls
Cancel barring for outgoing international calls
Check status for barring outgoing international calls

notes: Requires network barring password.

actions.description: Activate barring for outgoing international calls except to home PLMN country
Cancel barring for outgoing international calls except to home PLMN country
Check status for barring outgoing international calls except to home PLMN country

notes: Requires network barring password.

actions.description: Activate barring for all incoming calls
Cancel barring for all incoming calls
Check status for barring all incoming calls

notes: Requires network barring password. Affects voice, SMS.

actions.description: Activate barring for incoming voice calls
Cancel barring for incoming voice calls
Check status for barring incoming voice calls

function: Bar All Incoming Calls When Roaming

actions.description: Activate barring for all incoming calls when roaming outside home PLMN country
Cancel barring for all incoming calls when roaming outside home PLMN country
Check status for barring incoming calls when roaming

notes: Requires network barring password.

actions.description: Activate call waiting
Deactivate call waiting
Check call waiting status
End current call and accept waiting call
Put current call on hold and accept waiting call
Add held call to the current conversation (conference call) - Network dependent
Reject waiting call (or send to voicemail if configured)

notes: These are typically entered via the dial pad *during* an active call when another call comes in. Options may vary slightly.

actions.description: 1. Call first person. 2. Put them on hold (e.g., press '2' or Hold button). 3. Call second person. 4. Merge calls (e.g., press '3' or Merge button).
During conference: Hold conference, dial new number, merge call.
Speak privately with Nth participant (others on hold). Send '2'. Requires network support.
Disconnect Nth participant. Send '1'. Requires network support.

notes: Specific button presses (Hold, Merge) can vary by phone OS/UI. Codes '2+N' and '1+N' (where N is participant number) depend on network supplementary service support.

actions.description: Allow caller ID presentation for all outgoing calls (Network Default - Show Number)
Restrict caller ID presentation for all outgoing calls (Network Setting - Hide Number)
Check network setting for outgoing caller ID presentation
Restrict caller ID presentation just for the next outgoing call to 'number'
Allow caller ID presentation just for the next outgoing call to 'number' (overrides permanent restriction)

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: The full phone number to call (for one-time actions).

notes: Replace 'number' with the full phone number to call.

actions.description: Check if you are subscribed to Incoming Caller ID Presentation service (CLIP)

notes: Whether you *see* the incoming number depends on your subscription (CLIP) and whether the caller allows presentation (CLIR status). Activation (*30#) / Deactivation (#30#) by user is usually not supported.

actions.description: May display own phone number (Vodafone UK and others)
May display own phone number (Some European carriers)
Check number forwarded to when unreachable (Sometimes reveals own number if forwarded to self/voicemail linked)
May display own number (e.g., MTN South Africa)

notes: Not universally supported. Often easier to find in Phone Settings > About Phone > Status > My phone number.

actions.description: Display the device's IMEI number(s)

notes: Works on virtually all mobile phones. Will show multiple IMEIs for dual-SIM devices.

actions.description: May display SIM Serial Number (ICCID) on some networks/devices (e.g., Tesco Mobile UK - Unverified)

notes: Support is rare. ICCID is usually printed on the SIM card or found in Settings > About Phone > Status > SIM status.

actions.description: Display software version on older Nokia phones (Symbian/S40)

notes: Does not typically work on modern Nokia Android smartphones.

actions.description: Display hardware version on some older Samsung phones
Display software/firmware version (alternative) on some older Samsung phones

notes: Less common on modern devices. Use *#1234# or diagnostic menus for newer models.

actions.description: Check Network Lock (MCC+MNC) status
Check Provider Lock (GID1) status
Check Provider Lock (GID2) status
Check SIM Lock (IMSI) status

notes: To enter 'p', press * three times quickly; 'w', press * four times quickly; '+', press * twice quickly. Unlikely to work on modern smartphones.

function: Force Network Mode (via Android Testing Menu)

actions.description: Access Android Testing menu, then 'Phone information' to set preferred network type (e.g., LTE only, WCDMA preferred)

notes: Use with caution, selecting an unsupported mode can lead to loss of service.

actions.description: Change the SIM card PIN code

input_params.name: NewPIN
input_params.description: Your desired new SIM PIN (4-8 digits).

notes: Requires knowing the current (Old) PIN. PIN is usually 4-8 digits.

actions.description: Change the SIM card PIN2 code (used for Fixed Dialing Numbers, etc.)

notes: Requires knowing the current (Old) PIN2.

actions.description: Unblock SIM card (PIN1) using PUK code and set a new PIN

input_params.name: NewPIN
input_params.description: Your desired new SIM PIN (4-8 digits).

notes: PUK (PIN Unblocking Key) is provided by the network operator. Usually 8 digits.

actions.description: Unblock SIM card PIN2 using PUK2 code and set a new PIN2

notes: PUK2 code is provided by the network operator.

function: Factory Data Reset (Android - Generic, USE WITH EXTREME CAUTION)

actions.description: Removes Google account, app data and settings. Does NOT erase system software or media files. Prompts for confirmation.
COMPLETE WIPE / Factory Reset. Reinstalls firmware. ERASES ALL DATA INSTANTLY WITHOUT CONFIRMATION. EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. (Older devices, mainly Samsung)

notes: **WARNING:** These codes will erase data. *2767*3855# is particularly dangerous and often works instantly. Use Recovery Mode for factory reset on modern devices if possible. Prefer using Settings > System > Reset options.

actions.description: Common code (e.g., Vodafone India, MTN Ghana, Airtel Nigeria)

Check balance shortcut dial (Some US Prepaid - Dial #BAL)
Call Customer Service / IVR (Most North American Carriers: AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon, Bell, Rogers)

notes: Highly variable by carrier and country. Check carrier website for accurate codes.

Check data/min usage (Verizon US - Unlikely, Verizon uses #DATA or call 611)

actions.description: Activate international roaming - This is the code to SHOW caller ID for one call. Roaming activation usually done via app, website, or customer service.

input_params.name: number
input_params.description: The full phone number to call (to show caller ID).

notes: Included from user prompt, but *31*number# is NOT for roaming activation. It's for Caller ID. Roaming activation processes vary greatly.

actions.description: Activate data plan (MTN - Specific plan code for a specific country?)
Activate data plan (Airtel - Main *121# menu, option 2? Country specific?)

notes: Included from user prompt. Data plan activation codes are highly specific to the carrier, country, and the exact plan being purchased. Often done via a main menu USSD code (e.g., *131# for MTN, *121# for Airtel).
